Using latest code from HEAD.

1. Select all external plugins on the Target Platform preference page.
2. Import org.eclipse.ui alone.
3. Update its classpath, and you get the assertion failed below:

org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.Assert$AssertionFailedException: Assertion 
failed; Path for IClasspathEntry must be absolute..
at org.eclipse.jdt.internal.core.Assert.isTrue(Assert.java:87)
at org.eclipse.jdt.core.JavaCore.newLibraryEntry(JavaCore.java:1442)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.PluginPathUpdater.createLibraryEntry
(PluginPathUpdater.java:173)
at org.eclipse.pde.ui.BuildPathUtil.addLibraries(BuildPathUtil.java:206)
at org.eclipse.pde.ui.BuildPathUtil.addFragmentLibraries(BuildPathUtil.java:334)
at org.eclipse.pde.ui.BuildPathUtil.setBuildPath(BuildPathUtil.java:129)
at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.UpdateClasspathAction.setProjectBuil
dpath(UpdateClasspathAction.java:143)
at 
org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.UpdateClasspathAction.doUpdateClassp
ath(UpdateClasspathAction.java:127)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.UpdateClasspathAction.access$0
(UpdateClasspathAction.java:118)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.UpdateClasspathAction$2.run
(UpdateClasspathAction.java:92)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Workspace.run(Workspace.java:1361)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.imports.UpdateClasspathAction$1.run
(UpdateClasspathAction.java:95)
at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run
(ModalContext.java:98)

Good catch, Wassim. The problem was that PluginPathUpdater was 
calling 'JavaCore.newLibraryEntry' but the root path passed to it was resolved 
using ECLIPSE_HOME variable. I fixed the problem by checking the first segment 
of the root path. If it contains 'ECLIPSE_HOME' entry, I 
call 'JavaCore.newVariableEntry' instead. This fixed the problem.
